text.p: Let [mathjaxinline]A[/mathjaxinline] be a [mathjaxinline]6\times 4[/mathjaxinline] matrix. The equation [mathjaxinline]Ax = \mathbf{0}[/mathjaxinline] has the solution [mathjaxinline]x = \mathbf{0}[/mathjaxinline], which we call the trivial solution. If there are no solutions other than the trivial solutions, how many pivots must [mathjaxinline]A[/mathjaxinline] have when row-reduced?
